results.title: Muscles and bones of the body
results.brief_description: The importance of the muscles and bones to the internal and external functioning of the human body. How tendons, joints, muscles and the bones of the skeleton work smoothly together as one unit. The difference between voluntary and involuntary muscles and the importance of proper exercise and diet to a healthy body.
results.description: The importance of the muscles and bones to the internal and external functioning of the human body. results.title: Musclebound
results.brief_description: Bigorexia, “The Disease”. By definition every serious bodybuilder has it. And the relentless drive to grow it engenders, will push the afflicted through every pain barrier - punishing weights regimes and severe diets alike. This is a short piece about the mania of muscle building, body sculpting, unbridled narcissism and obsession; the drive for elusive physical perfection which keeps the bodybuilder pumping iron and gorging protein day in day out. Starring three times Mr Universe Charlie Duca and his sidekick training partner Jeff Hinch, as well as colossal ex-bodybuilder now personal trainer Big Al, the film will explore this extreme ‘sport’ which may be more appropriately termed a neurosis. Enter a culture where men heave huge slabs of metal into the air, eat kilos of boiled chicken breast, and then stand in front of a mirror and assess the symmetricality of their limbs with tape measures. As one ex builder says: “Michelangelo did it with stone. Some do it with clay, others with plaster. The bodybuilder does it with flesh.” But at what cost? - Sacha Ettinger-Epstein, 2004

results.title: Muscle: electrical activity of contraction
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
Demonstrates that all muscle contractions are initiated by nerve impulses and that electrical stimuli can initiate muscle contraction.

results.title: Muscle: dynamics of contraction
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
The many hundreds of muscles in the human body differ greatly with respect to the speeds at which they shorten. They can be divided into three major categories: smooth, cardiac and skeletal. In this film these three types are defined, and elaborate apparatus is used to reveal that the contractile properties of a whole muscle can be explained in terms of the properties of the single muscle cell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Muscle: chemistry of contraction
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program. Unit 4. Physiology”.
A brief resume of muscle histology, and sliding filament theory of muscle contraction. Emphasis shifts to chemical mechanism. The essential contractile element is actomyosin: ATP and calcium ions are also shown to be necessary. Experiments and simple models are used as illustrations. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles L. Finance and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Muscle beach
results.creator_credit: Strick Film Company, J Strick and I Lerner
results.brief_description: A humorous and poetic impression of the pursuit of physical culture on the San Monica Beach, California. The languor’s of a summer afternoon are contrasted satirically with the fervours of the body builders and devotees of physical exercise.

results.title: Muscle
results.creator_credit: Andreas Poulsson, ONF | NFB and Barry Lank
results.brief_description: Pat Feras, who is a social worker by profession, spends most of her leisure hours body building. This film shows Pat training for, and competing in, a women’s body building championship and includes fascinating footage, of the championship, both from backstage and upfront.
